name: Canned Tuna Pasta
author: ang-harding
summary: This is a big hit with the kids as it's easy to make and involves very little work. It can be made with or without mushrooms depending on your taste. You can spice it up to your liking, but my kids don't like it too spicy, so I keep it simple.
ingredients: 1 (5 ounce) can tuna packed in olive oil
½ (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened
½ (8.75 ounce) can sweet corn, drained
freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook elbow macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes
Meanwhile, drain olive oil from tuna can into a skillet over medium-low heat
Cook green onions and mushrooms until softened, 2 to 3 minutes
Add cream cheese and stir to combine
Reduce heat to low and stir in yogurt and lemon juice
Mix in sweet corn and drained tuna until well combined
Drain pasta, add to the skillet, and mix to combine
